xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 04 March 2014
xwikidoc.content: <puneet> has quit 01:29 <raghav> has quit 01:34 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 01:44 <SayAsh> has joined #phenotips 01:44 <SayAsh> has quit 01:53 <IonelPopescu> has quit 02:29 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 02:50 <IonelPopescu> has quit 02:56 <nileshc> has quit 03:24 <anishshah101> has joined #phenotips 03:29 <anishshah101> has quit 03:35 <reid_a> has quit 05:25 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 06:35 <gauravsaini03> has joined #phenotips 06:46 <SayAsh> has joined #phenotips 07:01 <IonelPopescu> has quit 08:01 <Ravneet> has quit 08:18 <gauravsaini03> has joined #phenotips 09:48 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 10:10 <mcupak> has quit 10:25 <IonelPopescu> has quit 10:35 <nclandrei> has joined #phenotips 10:35 <nclandrei> hi everyone 11:08 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 11:13 <sdumitriu_[Away]> is now known as <sdumitriu> 11:13 <sdumitriu> Hi nclandrei 11:15 <nclandrei> a bit later in the evening, can I send you a small draft of how the proposal would look like? 11:15 <nclandrei> :) 11:17 <sdumitriu> Sure 11:21 <nclandrei> has quit 11:28 <akif500> has quit 11:31 <pradeeban> has quit 11:33 <pradeeban1> has quit 11:35 <pradeeban2> has quit 11:38 <akats> has joined #phenotips 11:39 <pradeeban> has quit 11:50 <akats> So I'm doing some cleaning up, and I just pushed whatever changes I made working on the REST server. Though you might want to have the link https://github.com/soLEED/phenotips-1/commit/3a7fdff148bb48fcfc296b0c1b64644c369274a9 11:53 <pradeeban1> has quit 12:10 <akats> So can the phenomecentral repo compile into standalone, or do I have to put it into a the phenotips standalone 12:11 <sdumitriu> standalone should have everything 12:11 <akats> ok 12:26 <akats> On your computer do you have the version in phenotips-parent pom set as 1.0-milestone-10 or 1.0-SNAPSHOT? 12:28 <sdumitriu> SNAPSHOT 12:29 <akats> well... phenomecentral would not build until I changed the phenotips-parent pom to version 1.0-milestone-10 12:31 <sdumitriu> Hm... 12:31 <sdumitriu> What was the error? 12:32 <akats> Couldn't find the pom 12:32 <akats> the phenotips-parent 12:34 <vishnu93> has joined #phenotips 12:38 <akats> I like the front page design 12:41 <puneet_> has quit 12:49 <SayAsh> hi I have a question to ask? 12:49 <sdumitriu> Hi SayAsh, I guess you do 12:50 <akats> sdumitriu: so right now the registration form does not create a new user. Where does the request go? Somebody's email? 12:50 <sdumitriu> Yes 12:50 <sdumitriu> That is a custom form, not the registration 12:50 <sdumitriu> The goal is to replace it with your code 12:51 <SayAsh> ya, I want to know that we have to create a mobile application for phenotips or just a website interface that would work with mobile appropriately? 12:51 <sdumitriu> akats: Just pushed an update to the pom to make the build work 12:52 <akats> sdumitiu: And I'm assuming I should do that with an adapter which would create a new user 12:52 <akats> sdumitiu: thanks 12:52 <IonelPopescu> has quit 12:52 <sdumitriu> SayAsh: Not an application, just a skin for the website 12:53 <SayAsh> ok 12:54 <SayAsh> and the template for it would like what it is given in this page http://phenotips.org/UserGuide/GettingStarted right? 12:56 <SayAsh> and as you said just a skin for the website, then i think that u want that to work with both desktop and mobile browsers? 12:56 <sdumitriu> Yes, one flexible skin for every browser 13:02 <reid_a> has quit 13:26 <SayAsh> i have a doubt. In the "measurements" section for the patient information each time we enter a new entry. What I am thinking that the information which will going to remain same throughout should fill up automatically as a user clicks on "new entry". isn't it? 13:27 <sdumitriu> How do you know it should remain the same? 13:28 <sdumitriu> It's misleading data, unless the user clears it, it would seem that the doctor actually measured stuff and the numbers there are validated, which isn't the case 13:38 <SayAsh> ok, still what i am trying to convey is like take the eg of sitting height, then the length of arm and hand, that will going to remain same throughout the patient's life unless anything sever happens. So like these type of fields can be filled automatically though there would be an access to change those figures too in new entry if they had got change. This will going to save the time for the person who is filling. The weight and the height will be changin 14:01 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 14:12 <akats> sdumitriu: I should not include the xwikipreferences file in the commits, because I'm assuming it will overwrite whatever settings there already are? 14:12 <sdumitriu> You should, but with care 14:32 <pradeeban> has quit 15:02 <IonelPopescu> has quit 15:05 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 15:12 <SayAsh> has quit 15:21 <akats> So the registerinline template is overriden by XWiki/Registration 15:22 <akats> it's a fairly extensive document 15:22 <akats> I can include the current register page into it, which would take me some time 15:23 <akats> or I could include createUser() into the current Phenomecentral registration page 15:35 <vishnu93> has quit 15:58 <gauravsaini03> has quit 16:08 <akats> What should be the id of the xwiki document for the new user? There is no username. Should I put the email address? That is guaranteed to be unique. For example for admin it's xwiki:XWiki.Admin 16:09 <sdumitriu> No email address 16:10 <sdumitriu> The login won't work 16:10 <sdumitriu> You need to add the username field in the registration form 16:11 <akats> and then check for it's uniqueness 16:11 <sdumitriu> Yes 16:12 <sdumitriu> I guess the default registration page does that already 16:12 <sdumitriu> It has some live validation in it, you should reuse it 16:12 <akats> There's a macro if I remember correctly 16:12 <akats> Live as in javascript? 16:12 <sdumitriu> Yes 16:12 <akats> ok 16:26 <pradeeban> has quit 16:38 <akats> How would I change the document's (id?) from xwiki:data.WebHome to xwiki:XWiki.Username. document.rename() doesn't want to play nice. Is there another method, that would not require me to work with XWikiDocument rather than just Document? 16:38 <akats> That smiley is :d 16:38 <akats> :\d 16:39 <akats> without the \ 16:39 <sdumitriu> I don't see smileys, they're disabled 16:39 <sdumitriu> (for me) 16:39 <sdumitriu> I don't understand the question 16:43 <reid_a> has quit 16:44 <pradeeban> has quit 16:53 <akats> has quit 17:03 <IonelPopescu> has quit 17:10 <nclandrei> has joined #phenotips 17:18 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 17:37 <nclandrei> has quit 18:58 <IonelPopescu> has quit 19:03 <pradeeban> has quit 20:11 <nairboon> has quit 20:34 <SayAsh> has joined #phenotips 20:50 <nclandrei> has joined #phenotips 20:53 <SayAsh> has quit 20:56 <nclandrei> has quit 23:45 <nileshc> has quit
